intro: Silene radicosa subsp. rechingeri, commonly known as the Rechinger's campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate pink to red flowers and slender, branched stems. This subspecies is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in open habitats such as steppes and mountain slopes.
